intro: Orthotactus fulvohirsutus, commonly known as the hairy yellow orthotactus, is a small, herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its delicate structure and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less commonly studied species.
